content.question:
The recommended dietary allowance of iron for women under the age of <math alttext="51" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>51</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> milligrams (<math alttext="m g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) per day. A medical researcher studying women living in a certain region suspected that the women were getting less than the daily allowance of iron, on average. The researcher took a random sample of women under the age of <math alttext="51" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>51</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> from the region and measured their daily iron intakes. The following hypotheses were tested at the significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> for the population mean <math alttext="mu" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the daily iron intake for women in the region.
<math alttext="The null hypothesis is mu equals 18 and the alternative hypothesis is mu is less than 18" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>18</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

All conditions for inference were met, and the resulting <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value was <math alttext="0.031" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.031</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an appropriate conclusion?

choices.label: The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis should be rejected. There is convincing statistical evidence that the mean daily intake of iron for women in the region is less than the recommended <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis should be rejected. There is not convincing statistical evidence that the mean daily intake of iron for women in the region is less than the recommended <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis should not be rejected. There is not convincing statistical evidence that the mean daily intake of iron for women in the region is less than the recommended <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is greater than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis should be rejected. There is convincing statistical evidence that the mean daily intake of iron for women in the region is less than the recommended <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is greater than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis should not be rejected. There is not convincing statistical evidence that the mean daily intake of iron for women in the region is less than the recommended <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis should be rejected. There is convincing statistical evidence that the mean daily intake of iron for women in the region is less than the recommended <math alttext="18" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>18</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="milligrams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
